message: Excuse me for chiming in at this "default behavior is to return on the same synchronization context which it originated from" conversation. I think I understand Stephen's arguments on both the conceptual and practical perspective but, for the sake of completeness, Stephen can you also share/point me to a detail example showing what specific things that a "top-level" demo can NOT do if it does not have such a context? For example, in the "top-level methods" of this very blog post, what functionality would be lost if the calling pattern was "await GetJsonAsync(...).ConfigureAwait(false)"?
